result.execSummary:
The defendant Lacey Jonet Cloud was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland within 24 hours!
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.
  While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations through the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806
  All financial obligations paid through the Clerk of Courts office are subject to civil judgment and certification to the Department of Revenue on any balance owed after 60 days from entry of judgment.

miscConds.notes: All financial obligations added to payment plan, $45 per month beginning 10/5/17.
To seek, obtain and maintain full time employment.

Continue contact with doctor treating her for mental health concerns and follow through with any recommendations.
  The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.

Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are possessed or consumed.
  The Def is to take all medications as prescribed by treating physician and only in the manner & dosage as prescribed!
  Not to associate with any known drug users or those involved in trafficking, other than in a professional group counseling setting,meeting, or in a correctional setting.
  Any contraband seized to be forfeited!
  The Def is subject to random UA testing.
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen at the Ashland County Jail within 7 days.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment within 30 days and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

Defendant Lacey Jonet Cloud in court with attorney Daniel W Linehan.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 3 cases. DA comments on PSI, criminal hx is not accurate recites convictions. Def agrees with the record as recited, Atty Linehan does not have any comments on PSI. DA comments on sentencing. Atty Linehan/Defendant comments. Ct questions Def.   16CF100 wh 2 yr prob 16CF230 wh 2 1/2 yrs 16CM83 wh 1yr prob. Conditions of prob, absol, no mas, rx may take/is required to take as pres, no para, not present, nodru, aoda 30 days and ft, ua, full time employment, contact with dr treating her for MH concerns and follow rec, couns, contra, rep DOC 24 hrs, 7 days ACJ DNA.  16CF100 180 days jail, 0 cts, begin serving w/in 60 days, work release, may serve in Dunn co, contact ACJ w/in 7 days, extension contingent on good conduct, no gun no vote. Ct comments on payment plan is $100 behind, def just paid $90. Ct sets current, once employed what can she do? Asks to pay $45 per month, says she will be paid weekly. Next payment due 10/5 $45. Atty Linehan comments on Cts. Can brief the issue, Ct does not have the basis to grant cts.
